meanings.definition: To play a small drum or tabor.
meanings.sent1: She tabored on the drum at the school concert.
meanings.sent2: The musician tabored skillfully during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to tabored on the drum, amusing the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers tabored on the drum like raindrops on a roof.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of her taboring echoed through the room.

meanings.sent1: He tabored all day in the fields under the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: The workers tabored diligently to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tabored to gather nuts for the winter, a comical sight.
meanings.sent4: Her heart tabored with excitement as she waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The old machine tabored along, struggling to keep up with the new models.
